summary:
On June 18, 2023, a submersible named Titan, operated by OceanGate, exploded during a dive to explore the Titanic wreck. Five people died: OceanGate's CEO Stockton Rush, French explorer Paul-Henri Nargeolet, British businessmen Hamish Harding and Shahzada Dawood, and Dawood's son Suleman.

The submersible was found in pieces near the Titanic, indicating it imploded under pressure. Concerns about Titan's safety had been raised before the accident, but OceanGate ignored certification, claiming regulations slowed innovation. A large international team searched for the submersible.
title: Titan submersible implosion
